data.text: @NCTQ NUA's hybrid approach to teacher/student support uses technology to ensure that students keep thriving during this pandemic. Dynamic, engaging standards-based, pedagogy that situates learning in the lives of students is effective, home or school. #scienceofreading

@jmjpickford @NCTQ Baltimore, MD is another example of a district working to offer high-quality resources and learning acceleration to students in virtual and hybrid settings. #scienceofreading https://t.co/oz0ak6W13s
@NCTQ Florida Center for Reading Research has fabulous resources - and even has a page for families to better navigate their offerings: https://t.co/yB0ttiMulF #scienceofreading
@StudentSuccess @NCTQ There are states doing great work! #scienceofreading

@StudentSuccess @NCTQ And other states are working quickly to move more quality materials online and use summer programming to bolster learning at home. Texas Home Learning is one example with quality materials and aligned support by subject and grade level https://t.co/0ENqLBzuPF #scienceofreading
@NCTQ A5: States like Alaska have leveraged established programs to share high-quality virtual offerings for students. https://t.co/wZWZS8Bv8V
